coping_strategies: talking to a trusted friend or therapist
talking to a trusted friend or therapist
talking to a trusted friend or therapist
practice self-care by taking care of your physical and emotional needs. This can include things like getting enough sleep, eating healthy foods, and engaging in physical activity that you enjoy.
try to challenge negative thoughts about your appearance by focusing on your positive qualities and achievements.
talk to a therapist or counselor who can help you work through your feelings and develop coping strategies.
join a support group for people with body dysmorphic disorder to connect with others who understand what you're going through.
connect with others through social activities or hobbies that interest you.
try volunteering or joining a club or group that aligns with your interests.
practice self-care by engaging in activities that you enjoy and taking care of your physical and emotional needs.
consider talking to a therapist or counselor who can provide support and guidance for coping with loneliness.
